result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed drug testing.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 5 job applications per week.

miscConds.notes: Court waives court costs on all counts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed drug testing.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 applications per week.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Lafayette County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to all counts. State will state defendant's record but remain silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State gives defendant's record and remains silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Attorney Richard heard. Defendant not heard. Court heard and orders: 4 years WSPS (2in and 2out)-STAYED and imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: to participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate, to submit to random observed drug testing, to maintain full time employment or seek a rate of 5 job applications per week, court costs waived, and to provide a DNA sample. If revoked, 51 days credit granted. Defendant is eligible for substance abuse but not challenges.

and bail bond hearing. Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon in court, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. There is a global resolution with this case and 22CF175. Attorney Richards heard and is unsure on how to proceed. Court heard. Attorney Pozorski heard and will send a new offer to include this case,  22CF175, and the 2 cases with JD when a new attorney is appointed in 2CF175. Court denies defendant's request for bond modification. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court verbally reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Attorney Richards heard and requests bond to be reduced. Court heard and bond to remain. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker and Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Attorney Riniker requests $1000 cash bond, each case, totaling $3000. Attorney Richards heard. Court orders $1000 cash bond, each case. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
